title: Augusta County: Mary E.A. Dedrick to Henry H. Dedrick, February 1, 1862
summary: Mary discusses the disposition of their rye crop and the difficulty getting food. She also refers to their son's first birthday, which will occur in nine days.
keywords: Agriculture, Church/Religious Activity, Family, Home Front, Death/Casualties, Desertion/Leave, Mililtary Authority, American Civil War
